data.title: Kamal Hassan and Singeetam Srinivasa Rao Films
data.meta_description:
Sommokadidhi Sokokadidhi (1979) in Telugu was the first film of Singeetam Srinivasa Rao and Kamal Haasan together.

He also directed Kamal Haasan in his 100th film Raja Paarvai / Amavasya Chandrudu (1981).

In 1988, when Rajkumar announced his desire to temporarily retire from acting, Singeetam decided to concentrate on Tamil movies where he mostly had Kamal Haasan in the lead roles.

In 1988, he co-produced, scripted and directed the first Indian dialogue-less film, Pushpaka Vimana which received special mention at Shanghai Film Festival.When he was working with Rajkumar, Srinivasa Rao was introduced to Rajkumar's relative, actor Shringar Nagaraj who decided to co-produce Pushpaka Vimana.The film was listed among CNN-IBN's 'Hundred greatest Indian films of all time'

The comedy-drama blockbuster Apoorva Sagodharargal (1989) was one of the enduring works on dwarfism in popular media.The film won the Filmfare Award for Best Film – Tamil, and was premiered at the International Film Festival of India. 

The 1990 action comedy, Michael Madana Kama Rajan - a movie about quadruplets - became an instant hit at the box office.
data.text:
Sommokadidhi Sokokadidhi (1979) in Telugu was the first film of Singeetam Srinivasa Rao and Kamal Haasan together.

He also directed Kamal Haasan in his 100th film Raja Paarvai / Amavasya Chandrudu (1981).

In 1988, when Rajkumar announced his desire to temporarily retire from acting, Singeetam decided to concentrate on Tamil movies where he mostly had Kamal Haasan in the lead roles.

In 1988, he co-produced, scripted and directed the first Indian dialogue-less film, Pushpaka Vimana which received special mention at Shanghai Film Festival.When he was working with Rajkumar, Srinivasa Rao was introduced to Rajkumar's relative, actor Shringar Nagaraj who decided to co-produce Pushpaka Vimana.The film was listed among CNN-IBN's 'Hundred greatest Indian films of all time'

The comedy-drama blockbuster Apoorva Sagodharargal (1989) was one of the enduring works on dwarfism in popular media.The film won the Filmfare Award for Best Film – Tamil, and was premiered at the International Film Festival of India.

The 1990 action comedy, Michael Madana Kama Rajan - a movie about quadruplets - became an instant hit at the box office.
